meanings.definition: Capable of coexisting harmoniously with living tissue or a living system.
meanings.sent1: The new implant is biocompatible, meaning it can peacefully exist alongside the body's tissues.
meanings.sent2: Doctors prefer using biocompatible materials for implants to ensure they work well with the body.
meanings.sent3: The biocompatible gel seemed to get along with the cells, almost like a friendly neighbor.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as biocompatible as a perfect puzzle piece fitting into place.
meanings.sent5: The biocompatible paint adhered smoothly to the wall, like it belonged there all along.

meanings.definition: A substance or material that does not produce a toxic or immunological response when in contact with living tissue.
meanings.sent1: The researchers tested the biocompatible material on cells to ensure it was safe for use.
meanings.sent2: Hospitals often use biocompatible substances in medical devices to avoid allergic reactions.
meanings.sent3: The biocompatible solution was so gentle that even the cells seemed to thank it.
meanings.sent4: The biocompatible fabric felt like a hug to the skin, causing no irritation.
meanings.sent5: The biocompatible coating on the stent protected the tissue without any negative effects.

meanings.definition: Compatibility with living organisms or biological systems.
meanings.sent1: The biocompatible nature of the new drug made it suitable for use in various organisms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the biocompatible properties of materials to understand their effects on organisms.
meanings.sent3: The biocompatible environment in the lab seemed to make the plants grow faster.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was as biocompatible as a plant thriving in the right soil.
meanings.sent5: The biocompatible relationship between the virus and the host puzzled researchers with its lack of harm.
